_comment: Created by EFisher on 24/01/2014 17:01:21 using v2.0
title: Which organisations are responsible for the number of patients delayed?
analysis_commentary: A decrease in the number of patients delayed over time can be seen when either NHS or social care organisations, or both, are responsible for the delay. However, delays due to social care have fallen the most, a 39% decrease in the number of patients experiencing a delay in discharge between August 2010 (1,723 patients) and July 2013 (1,051 patients. This is compared to a 9% decrease when attributable to NHS organisations.
data_source: NHS England, Delayed transfer of care
